intro: Dissochaeta velutina var. reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined velvetweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive, reticulate venation pattern. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries that are dispersed by animals.
